page.title: 05A CONTRACT FARMER (CONT.)
page.content: AT HARVEST_TIME HIS MACHINERY COVERS APPROXIMATELY ONE THOUSAND ACRES OF LAND. IF HIS SERVICES ARE NOT REQUIRED Mr. ASQUITH SERVICES AND REPAIRS HIS MACHINERY READY FOR THE NEXT SEASON. HE HAS TWO ASSISTANTS - ONE FULL TIME AND ONE PART TIME. Mr. ASQUITH HIMSELF OWNS 40 ACRES OF LAND WHICH HE FARMS IN HIS SPARE TIME. HIS FUEL BILLS, EXCLUDING OIL, ARE Â£3000 TO Â£4000 A YEAR. WHEN HE FIRST STARTED WORK Mr. ASQUITH USED THE OLD THRESHING MACHINES, CUTTING WITH A BINDER AND HE WORKED ALL THROUGH WINTER AND SUMMER. NOWADAYS THE MACHINES ARE BIGGER AND THE WORK IS DONE MORE QUICKLY BUT THERE ARE FEWER FARMS SO HE HAS LESS WORK. IN THE FUTURE Mr. ASQUITH THINKS THERE WILL ALWAYS BE A NEED FOR CONTRACT FARMERS.
